text: U.S. copyright was issued to William K. L. Dickson for a "publication" consisting of "Edison Kinetoscopic Records." It was the first motion picture copyright in North America. No torrents were uploaded until much later.
Edwin H. Armstrong received a US patent for a "Wireless Receiving System" which described his famous regenerative, or feedback, circuit. Armstrong would go on to pioneer FM radio.
Al Jolson appeared on a movie screen in New York City and said for all to hear "Wait a minute, wait a minute, you ain't heard nothin' yet." It was the first talkie.
